availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Elisha B. Gardner (Green County, Kentucky, farmhand and soldier.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmhand and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William Gardner and Frances Gardner. Stepson of Ann Maria Gibson Gardner. Married to Nancy E. Gardner in Breckenridge County, Kentucky, on January 29, 1865. Attended school in Louisville in 1850. Farmhand in Green County in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private, corporal, sergeant, and lieutenant from December 31, 1861, to January 12, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 1, p. 15A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 700.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breckenridge County, Cloverport, p. 62A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0264.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Breckenridge County Marriages, Film 1877050.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994038, Hart County Marriages.
"Elisha B. Gardner (1839-1905)," Find A Grave, Memorial 176972534, accessed February 27, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/176972534.
